/notes/Create-a-large-file-on-Linux.title: Create a large file on Linux
/notes/Create-a-large-file-on-Linux.content:
Sometimes we need to have a random file of given size. We can name some common examples such as

-   Test the file upload functionality
-   Test if the application is able to handle a large set of data

On Linux we can create an empty file of particular size with theÂ `dd`Â command. The following command createsÂ `sample.txt`Â file ofÂ `1GB`:

```shell
$ dd if=/dev/urandom of=sample.txt bs=1G count=1
```

The file size is the result ofÂ `bs * count`Â in bytes.

Ref: https://getfrontend.tips/create-a-big-file-on-linux/
